title: How to Make an All Natural Fizzy Watermelon Drink

steps.headline: Make tea.
steps.description: Use Green Tea, Earl Grey, PG Tips, anything you like, as long as it's all natural. Do not add milk or sugar unless you want to. Pour into a jug or pitcher.

steps.headline: Add a pinch of nutmeg and a pinch of cinnamon to the tea.
steps.description: This will infuse as it chills.

steps.headline: Add the clear honey and stir through.
Place in the refrigerator to chill.
Fill another jug or pitcher with ice leaving enough room to pour in the bottle of sparkling water and add lemon wedges.
steps.description: Place into the refrigerator to chill further.

steps.headline: Prepare the fruits:
steps.description: Cut the watermelon into chunks. Remove the peel and seeds. Remove the cherry pits. Cut the pineapple into chunks.

steps.headline: Remove both jugs or pitchers from the refrigerator.
steps.description: Pour the two drinks in a larger jug or pitcher to mix together. Add the chopped fruits. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: Place back in the refrigerator to chill until needed.
Serve.
steps.description: Pour into tall glasses and garnish with a fruit wedge of choice. Serve with a plate of homemade cinnamon dusted shortbread cookies (biscuits), that earlier mentioned frozen Bounty bar, or perhaps both.

text: Make tea. Use Green Tea, Earl Grey, PG Tips, anything you like, as long as it's all natural. Do not add milk or sugar unless you want to. Pour into a jug or pitcher. Add a pinch of nutmeg and a pinch of cinnamon to the tea. This will infuse as it chills. Add the clear honey and stir through.  Place in the refrigerator to chill.  Fill another jug or pitcher with ice leaving enough room to pour in the bottle of sparkling water and add lemon wedges. Place into the refrigerator to chill further. Prepare the fruits:  Cut the watermelon into chunks. Remove the peel and seeds. Remove the cherry pits. Cut the pineapple into chunks. Remove both jugs or pitchers from the refrigerator. Pour the two drinks in a larger jug or pitcher to mix together. Add the chopped fruits. Stir to combine. Place back in the refrigerator to chill until needed.  Serve. Pour into tall glasses and garnish with a fruit wedge of choice. Serve with a plate of homemade cinnamon dusted shortbread cookies (biscuits), that earlier mentioned frozen Bounty bar, or perhaps both.
